sentence: Whenever you need it, it needs to upgrade the bridge.
Location awareness/geofencing still doesn't work.
Any time I enable it and leave the screen and come back, it shows as disabled again.
Even if I go into the leaving and coming home interfaces, uncheck and recheck the boxes for the rooms I want this for, and click save, the location awareness toggle still flips back to off.

This has been a problem for months and I still typically use the gen 1 app because it is a little more reliable, but now they are prompting users in that app that it is no longer supported and should switch to this one.
Well I switched to this one again and I have to say I still don't believe I'm actually using a supported app.
It's ok but yet the hue bridge doesn't connect
Can't connect outside of home WiFi anymore.
Why?
It's a great App never had any problems  with this,only onwards and upwards.
When it works it is awesome.
But most of the time it doesn't.
Then there is the flickering.
If you are in the app, and haven't told it to do anything, it can flicker.
Nothing is consistent though.
It didn't always work, and it doesn't always flicker.
OK start Philips but you can do much better here.
E.g.
Alarms should allow aight to be dimmed to a custom level...Then brighten from there.
The main app is OK but the widgets don't remember light state when using more than one bulb... useless
Simple, very easy to use, clean interface.
My only complaint is that I wish you could phase on a particular light "manually" (like in the older Hue app), rather than turning it on then phasing it down.
Beyond that, love this flexibility with lighting!
Gen 2 app is marginally better.
Way more intuitive to use.
Should have left as is, but just make it easier to adjust brightness
Latest hub firmware update messed more up than it fixed - also this app is useless compared to almost any other hue lighting app.
Why isn't it the best?
It's the official app and you're Phillips - get programming and add features.
It's so limiting and restrictive.
Life your game.
Impenetrable guff.
Remains unrecognizable despite all gear installed, searched..... and unfound!
Needed some timers and more features
Amazing
I don't know why this is only 2.8 stars, it works fine for me!
Can't fault this app, set up lights very easily.
Time (routines) you're lights very easily, and tested whilst on holiday and can control it without problems.
Home tracking doesn't work as others have said, that's not an issue for me.
I'm only using white b22 & gu10 bulbs.
App never wants to close
You had a "random switch" that let an alarm randomly activate within a 30min window in the old app.
Please add it to the new one.
Leaving this at 1 star until they fix basic features, particularly geofencing.
The fact that Philips remains silent on this broken app is infuriating.
Location awareness not woking.
Big Fail.
Does not recognise it's own lamps without painfully entering serial numbers.
Does not recognise GU10 RGB Lightify Bulbs at all, as dealer promised.
0 points for customer experience.
The opposite of smooth.
Last update finally works as it ought.
Connected to the bridge and lights without a hitch and no presets lost.
I cannot setup location triggered events even though permissions have been granted to the app.
This app never gave me a notification that it needed to be updated.
I went to use it one day and it forced an update on me.
Like I couldn't control any of my lights until I installed the updates.
This was extremely inconvenient as u was trying to get out the door.
Not to mention the scenes don't sync across the entire room.
Great product supported by a horrible app.
Garbage.
Bugy application, doesn't save the changes or settings in map location and intensity of the light.
Does what it's supposed to do.
I can't keep logged in

This should be fixed as it is one of the main features of the hue system
It's getting alot better!
The new version is finally good.
The old app was great this is bumb down to work with I phones.
Widget's no longer work with Nougat.
Location aware completely broken, can't even turn it on.
As this is a massively advertised feature and this has been broken for months this is really poor.
Dropped to 1 star as lack of response to a big broken feature shows the developer doesn't care about issues.
The first gen app still works better than this one and I wish they'd keep updating the old app.
This app constantly looses connection to the bridge and randomly shuts off my lights.
The old app was solid and all features work as expected.
This new one is just packed with bugs.
Turn lights on or off based on location?
This app can't even keep the settings enabled.
Also not being able to assign all lights in a preset is just lame.
The old app allowed this, why does the new one need to be room based?
Fix the geolocation issue please, it's a real letdown that it doesn't work on a lot of devices.
Location aware won't stay on.

Completely useless feature.
Not as advertised.

So unreliable and buggy.
The nest link has got issues and I can't reconnect it and it just useless
Never connects if I'm away so what's the point?
Why is the app becoming more basic?
It's clunky and has few options.
This should be smooth, beautiful, and give us options to really use these lights to their full potential.
Third party apps are better.
Come on, how is that even.a thing?
Fire your designer and hire some creative minds.
Works like a charm.
Also, nice job with the recent updates.
Clear cut, responsive.
Love it.

awesome

Instead it wakes up to whatever scene I went to sleep to.
Also waiting on a fix to home/away.

There needs to be an option to have lights just turn on and off without that!

Have to do it manually every time?
Fix THAT and I'll probably rate five star.

After that works just fine.
Love my new light system.
Pretty dope

I love it

Awesome
I love the lights but the software leaves much to be desired .. 1: Sometimes the app doesn't connect to the Hue bridge  2: Why no brightness control from the widget?
Why must I go into the app just to adjust the brightness?!
Just add a brightness slider to the widget damn you!
3: Why no function to have the lights slowely fade cycle through a changeable list of colours, like other Philips hue lights?
These are all easy things to do Philips, sort it!
Good app for the most part, I wouldn't be as willing to slam it as much as other reviewers thanks to recent updates.
Location tracking however doesn't work, settings don't save correctly, as soon as you exit the screen it just reverts to it previous state making the feature unusable.
The are some infrequent connection errors however restarting the app can often solve these.
Philips you should get on this, compared to iOS support Android is poor.
Again many months later there is still no fix in sight...
Just gave up on the wemo system and came over to Hue.
Wish I'd done it sooner.
This system is much more reliable, easier to set up, and the colour effects are pretty cool.
Could it be tweaked?
Sure.
For example, it would be great to combine multiple routines into one so you didn't have to reset them all to occur consecutively.
But I'm very very happy with the system as is.
My phone always says out of home connection.
Its slow and locks up often could use some help
Stick with the (not great) old app until this is overhauled.
Home & Away function turns on the lights randomly during the night.
(Sleep interruption)  Bridge updates are compulsory during which it's impossible to turn lights on (or off).
(Accident waiting to happen).
Premium priced bulbs with poor software implementation.
Works the way it's supposed to.
I don't get all of the negative reviews.
I mean sure it's nothing special, but it works, and it's easy to use.
It's sure as hell alot better than the previous version.
A few things that can be improved:  App itself seems to have problems maintaining connection to My Hue when shifting between WiFi/mobile connection.
This causes the app to be caught in limbo, being logged in, but offline, without any option to logout.
In 'Scenes' there are three presets, these can be altered, but the change is not saved.
The 'Bright' scene is a bit too bright for me.
Also it would be nice if I could add 'Routines' and other editorial things offline, which then syncs when I open the app at home.
FRICKING PURPLE!!!

On other nights I think I've turned them on but when I come home the house is dark.

You get an error stating that a group name already exists when attempting to recreate a group, and then you don't even have the ability to delete it.
Just ridicules..

Another issue is that there is no save button for the geofence setting and it always takes two attempts to connect.

It's a decent app.
Most everything works.
My only complaint are the widgets.
They don't work correctly.
The widget state always shows the light as off even though it's on.
So you have to always press it twice to turn off a light.
The app works in general but there is a bug in fade in function.
i.e.
If wake up time is set to 7:30 and fade in time to 30 minutes then "if light was off" it will turn on properly at 7:00.
That's good!
But when on a particular day I woke up at 6:30 and I turned the light on already with remote control then guess what happens??
At 7:00 when the program starts it will first turn OFF the light and will start to fade in for those 30 minutes.
That's not how it should work.
If light is fully on then it's on and program should not interfere with it.
Eventually add an "Override = yes/no" functionality to fade in/out program as some people may still want it to work it is now.
Now I don't have access to the full colour pallette with my Gen1 bulbs!

Where do I submit feature requests?
It needs the ability to register an "off" scene.
For example, I have a ceiling and corner lamp in my living room.
Using the dimmer is both on or both off, even if I set them up as separate rooms.
Most times I want only the corner lamp (which has 2 bulbs).
If I could set an off scene in dimmer press 1 to 3, then dim at 4 and bright at 5 for only the ceiling light, that would do.
It's not possible to use one dimmer to control 2 lights separately, or should I say, independently.

Location aware does not work.
Read forums and you'll find this has been an issue for many months and Philips doesn't seem to care.
If this were the only app available for controlling Hue lights, it would be somewhat mediocre.
Given that there are many different apps, all of which seem to specialize in different areas with no one single app providing EVERYTHING that you would want, this fits into the tool set usefully.
The Philips Hue app controls adding lights, naming them, assigning them to groups with relative ease.
It handles updates to firmware and addition of accessories like the motion detector and dimmer switches more easily than other apps.
It does *not* do color management or preset management well.
If you are listening, Philips, I would love to have better preset management and ways to set up triggers and animations, using your accessories.
The motion detector desperately needs a way to set end time.
Better integration with IFTTT too.
There are apps on iOS which do creative things like animations that no Android app seems to handle well.
But overall, this is a fine basic app.
I use it for simple things, quickly, and it is fine.
Plez add more features
Location Aware doesn't work at all, which you need for routines that turn on and off lights whether you're home or away.

This is the first time I have ever left a review for a product.
But, I felt so strongly that I was compelled to write, as I hope if enough people complain Philips will take notice.
The app is useless.
I have to use a third party app (Hue Pro) to control my lights.
It is bad when an outsider does a better job at interacting with your product then your own app does.
I recently purchased a motion sensor to accompany to my lights.
However, I have to go through the official app to add it to my system, as I didn't see a way to do it in the 3rd-party app.
I am stuck in a never ending loop of "An Update Is Available for your Hue Bridge".
After watching it, rather unsuccessfully, look like it was partially installing the update, I get the message that an error occurred and to try again.
And not just once, but DOZENS of times.
Just when it appears that all is not lost (and the app tells me that the update is successful), I click DONE and and it informs me that an update is available.
Hmmmm.
Weird, I just installed a freaking update like five times!!!
Today!
And of course, there is no way to bypass this screen so that I can interact with my system.
Conclusion: unless you love being frustrated, staring at the same screen over and over and have tons of time to waste, then you should find another app (like Hue Pro) to use for your bulbs.
Just know that adding accessories to your system is also going to be a pain.
If the app doesn't get better, I will never buy another bulb or accessory from Philips.
Isn't the point to make life easier?
Not make it infuriating.
